meanings.definition: To fix firmly in a surrounding mass
meanings.sent1: The roots of the tree were imbedded in the soil.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler imbedded the gemstone into the ring setting.
meanings.sent3: The curious squirrel imbedded its acorn treasure in the soft ground.
meanings.sent4: Her words were imbedded in my mind, like a permanent memory.
meanings.sent5: The ancient fossil was imbedded in the rock, telling a story of the past.

meanings.sent1: The secret message was imbedded within the code.
meanings.sent2: The warmth of the blanket imbedded her in comfort.
meanings.sent3: The cat imbedded itself in the cozy blanket, purring contentedly.
meanings.sent4: His kindness imbedded itself in the hearts of those he helped.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh bread imbedded itself in the kitchen, inviting all to enjoy.
